name: ash

ash noun
(POWDER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the soft grey or black powder that is left after a substance, especially tobacco, coal, or wood, has burned: cigarette ash
Iuliia Alekseeva/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages ashes [ plural ]
what is left of something after it has been destroyed by fire, especially what is left of a human body after it has been burned: Her ashes were scattered at sea.

ash noun
(COLOUR)
[ U ] a light colour that is greyish or does not have any red in it: ash blonde His wife is tall, with ash blonde hair. The restaurant's stunning interior is decorated in soft shades of plum, ash, and cream.
More examplesFewer examplesEverything is in muted shades of grey, ash, and pink.The costume designer's palette is white on ash, grey on dusty brown, ebony on bone.I usually wear silver - yellow gold clashes with my ash blonde colouring. Around him he saw no black hair, only light ash browns, soft greys, and pale platinums. He's not going grey but the hair colour is fading, now more of an ash shade.
